Reviews.Title: A WORKHORSE - GOING ON 5 YEARS 50-80 HOURS A WEEK
Reviews.Author: E. B. MULLIGAN "Bronwyn"
Reviews.Content: A WORKHORSE - GOING ON 5 YEARS 50-80 HOURS A WEEKI can't say enough good things. Dependable, sturdy, fine screen, good weight, decent speed, meets all my business needs, very low maintenance. Everything still in perfect working order 54 months later.* Wireless-N, based on 802.11n technology, with up to 5X the speed and 2X the range of traditional Wi-Fi® when used with a Wireless-N router3* Display WXGA+ (1440 x 900 resolution) WXGA (1280 x 800 resolution)* HyperBand Diversity Antenna delivers superior multi-band wireless performance for mobile broadband and Wi-Fi* Integrated Bluetooth 2.0 with Enhanced Data Rate makes it easy to connect personal devices* Built-in Dell WiFi Catcher(tm) Utility switch lets you quickly find a network, even when the laptop's closed* The latest Intel® Core(tm)2 Duo processors, with Intel integrated graphics for optimal battery life.* Genuine Windows Vista® Business or Genuine Windows® XP Professional* Performance hard-drive options including 7200 RPM, Hybrid hard drive* Power Supply: 65 Watt or 90 Watt AC adapter with cord wrappingBatteries featuring ExpressCharge(tm) : Primary 4-cell/32 WHr; Primary 6-cell/56 WHr; Primary 9-cell/85 WHr with 90 watt AC adapter; Secondary 6-cell/48 WHr "Smart" Li-Polymer batteryWEIGHT & DIMENSIONS: Starting at: 4.37lbs/1.98kg Width: 13.27"/337.1mm Depth: 9.37"/238mm Height: 1.26"/32mm* PC Card: One Type I or Type II; Supports 34mm ExpressCard via USB interface through PCMCIA adapterPorts: Serial, docking connector, 4 USB, 1394, VGA, headphone/speaker out, RJ-11, RJ-45, AC power, integrated microphoneDocking: D/Port, D/Dock, D/View Laptop Stand, D/Monitor StandModular Options: DVDROM, 24X CD-ROM, 8X DVD +/-RW7, 24X CDRW/DVD, Floppy Disk Drive, Secondary 6-cell battery, 80GB8 Hard Drive or Travel Lite Module* Wired: Wired: 56K v924 Internal Modem 10/100/1000 Gigabit6 Ethernet network interface adaptorWireless: Dell Wireless 5520 Mobile Broadband (Tri-band HSDPA 3.6) Mini-Card with service from AT&T; (US) and Vodafone (select countries in Europe) Dell Wireless 5720 Mobile Broadband (EVDO Rev A) Mini-Card with service from Verizon Wireless (US), Sprint (US) and Telus (Canada)WLAN Dell Wireless 1390 (802.11g); Dell Wireless 1490 (802.11a/g); Dell Wireless 1505 (802.11a/g/Draft n); Intel PRO/Wireless 3945AG (802.11a/g); Intel PRO/Wireless 4965AGN (802.11a/g/ Draft n) Mini-Cards, Dell Wireless 360 Bluetooth 2.0 internal wireless card (upgradable to Bluetooth 2.1 EDR) (optional).TNVIDIA Quadro NVS 135M offers all the latest graphics technology to produce extraordinary visual effects, robust wide-aspect LCD support and compatibility with all major business applications.Intel® Graphics Media Accelerator X3100 (Up to 256MB shared5) is an intelligent and responsive graphics engine built into the chipset that is on the motherboard. This integration provides incredible visual quality, faster graphics performance and flexible display options

Reviews.Title: Great laptop!
Reviews.Author: T. Thrush "snowbear55"
Reviews.Content: I really like this laptop. I did my homework before I bought it. Runs like new, Windows XP, few small, slight scratches. Good deal for the price. The seller was great as well. I think this laptop is going to be around for a good while. One thing I need to add to this review, when I bought it I had to email the seller for the original install disk that was supposed to come with it. Well I did get it but it lacks the COA. So now, after a year, I want to reinstall Windows XP. Hey, forget it, no COA! Can't use it without a COA. I don't use this laptop much, just for hooking up my embroidery machine to it.

Reviews.Title: Dell Latitude D630 Intel Core 2 Duo 2000 MHz 320Gig Serial ATA HDD 1024mb...
Reviews.Author: humblepie
Reviews.Content: i bought this for my wife and she loves it, enough saidwhen shes happy im happy so i love it also

Reviews.Title: This is a review on the computer, not the seller.
Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little computer, albeit used. I still love windows XP Pro, and everything is as it should be. I am someone who uses some older, expensive software programs, and love that I feel safe using them on this computer.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Sherman Weimer
Reviews.Content: Only real positive thing I can say is that it was very well packaged for shippment. The first thing that popped up when I first turned it on was a warning that the battery was approaching the end of its useable life.  The second thing was it wouldn't connect to an unsecured network. The third thing is the two most used keys - the space bar and the enter key are sticking.  I had a very experienced computer technician stop by my office and he could not get it to connect to an unsecured network either.  He has since taken it back to his shop to probably replace the wireless card.  I wasn't expecting a new computer, but for nearly $300 I figured it would be a useable computer in good shape.  Should probably have spent the extra money and purchased a new one, since I will now have the repair bill on the wireless card as well.  It did have a short warrenty, but it took two weeks to arrive and I've messed around another two weeks with it now, so cannot afford another 4-6 weeks to ship it back and have the seller repair it.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME laptop
Reviews.Author: Sandra Randol
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop in May of last year 2013. Just needed something to keep in contact with my grandchildren. I have had no trouble at all with it ..I did have a sound problem just recently  through no fault of cravingsavings it was because I let someone use it and they took out the sound drivers. I contacted cravinsavings and they helped me get it going.. I would recommend this highly!!

Reviews.Title: Really good computer for home use!
Reviews.Author: Kurt Smith
Reviews.Content: This computer is really great if you need it for internet use, office, and maybe some games. It works fine and EVERYTHING you need is included!PROS:Windows XP (super-duper easy to use!)Not too big and not too smallDoesn't slow down with big programsCD drive that doesn't get jammed99% of programs work on it (can't say that about Windows 8!)Two built-in mouse controls in case one freezesCONS:Just about the only con is the fact that in April 2014, Microsoft will end support for XP. That will mean that you'll have to get a security program to keep your stuff safe! It costs a bit of money, but it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good Thank God
Reviews.Author: Terrence Thompson
Reviews.Content: Very good for price. Is functioning well. Could use a little more information however on capabilities of hi tech devices like this. (ie USB ports dont function correctly) But overall good.

Reviews.Title: The laptop was very good. The stated software on it was misleading...
Reviews.Author: JAMES N GROSS
Reviews.Content: The laptop was very good. The stated software on it was misleading. They said it had Office on it. It WAS NOT Microsoft Office..... But a cheap version.... had to go and buy Microsoft Office to do my work... I would not have bought this if I know that.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: K. Ipock "PONYDOC"
Reviews.Content: I desperately needed 2 quality XP laptops to run an ultrasound machine for my veterinary clinic. I was having problems locating XP laptops that were not bottom end computers. These fit my needs exactly, were very reasonably priced, and looked like new when they got here. AND, they got here about 8-10 days before the projected delivery date! I will definitely do this again.
